results.title: Your amazing mind
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins and Alfred Higgins Productions
results.brief_description: Opens with a lengthy discussion of the importance of human brain power in the progress of civilisation. Proceeds to discuss the different types of drugs available and the dangers of using them without prescription. Explains various types of drugs and discusses the effects of each on the human brain.

results.title: Young women of Japan
results.creator_credit: Iwanami Productions and Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Illustrates the role of women in Japan’s development in manpower, technical skill and creative talent, by showing examples of young women working in air transport, clothing, graphic design, farming, broadcasting and manufacturing.

results.title: Young job seekers package (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Consists of six programmes designed to help young people in the search for work. The program also provides comments from the employers point of view re each applicant. No other credits available.

results.title: Young film makers
results.creator_credit: Eugene Schlusser and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: A grade 6 class at Kananook Primary School show how they made a film. During a visit to ABC Channel 2 they learned about make-up, back drops and costumes. After long discussion the script was worked out, actors chosen, props and costumes made and locations chosen.

results.title: Young airmen: new strength for the RAAF
results.brief_description: The training of 16-year-old men as radio engineers at Melbourne Technical College. This info-documentary highlights the training and education of young men to join the air force. They are trained in radio, morse code and other techniques to allow them to detect enemy planes in darkness. “Radio technology is the tool of the future for communication” (1950). Photography: Geoff Thompson.
results.title_for_label: Young airmen: new strength for the RAAF

constellations_other.name: Place, portraiture, performance
constellations_other.description: The nature of the collaboration between David Dalaithngu and Rolf De Heer on Ten Canoes connects the film to their other collaborations, and a number of other works as well.

results.title: You Must Remember This
results.creator_credit: Helen Bowden, Susan MacKinnon and Vivid Pictures
results.brief_description: Alzheimer’s disease is very common, mysterious and fatal. This film follows the course of the disease from diagnosis to death. It looks at the subtle, early signs of Alzheimer’s disease and the slow loss of language, memory and skills. It looks at what is known about its causes, current treatments and where the hopes for a cure lie.

results.title: You might as well live
results.creator_credit: Con Anemogiannis, Judy Menczel and Fortian Productions
results.brief_description: ‘You might as well live’ is an excellent documentary on the subject of youth suicide in Australia. The film examines why Australia has such a high youth suicide rate and what can be done about it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Con Anemogiannis, Judy Menczel and Fortian Productions
